children.name: Ground shelter
children.shortdesc: The Ground shelter is a sheltered basic enclosure with one rack installed.

children.name: FM200 Cylinder
children.shortdesc: The FM200 Cylinder is a component of the Fire Suppression System.

children.name: HVAC Control Panel
children.shortdesc: The HVAC Control Panel controlls the Air Conditioning Unit.

children.name: Air Conditioning Unit
children.shortdesc: The Air Conditioning Unit controls the environment in the ground shelter.

children.name: CO2 Fire Extinguisher
children.shortdesc: CO2 Fire Extinguishers are used for manual fire fighting.

children.name: Main Distribution Board (MDB)
children.shortdesc: The Main Distribution Board is part of the electricity supply system.

children.name: UPS Main Distribution Board (MDB)
children.shortdesc: The MDB is designed to protect the distribution boards, electrical installations in the ground shelter and the connections for the UPS, ACs, lighting etc.

children.name: Internal Light
children.shortdesc: The internal light provides sufficient light within the ground shelter.

children.name: Motion Detector
children.shortdesc: The Motion Detector registers the presence of humans.

children.name: Ground Shelter Rack
children.shortdesc: The Ground Shelter Rack contains most control components for the Ground Shelter.

children.name: Optical Distribution Frame (ODF)
children.shortdesc: The Optical Distribution Frame (ODF) is a component used for connecting fiber cables.

children.name: UPS (Rack)
children.shortdesc: The UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply) protects electronic equipment from power outages and fluctuations.

children.name: VMD Server
children.shortdesc: The Video Motion Detection (VMD) helps with the automatic analysis of IR camera video streams.

children.name: PM PDU
children.shortdesc: The Power Management (PM) Power Distribution Unit (PDU) monitors all connected devices.

children.name: Scanter 5202
children.shortdesc: The TERMA radar sensor system consists of a transceiver and an antenna unit.

children.name: Waveguide Assembly
children.shortdesc: The Waveguide Assembly provides a special form of transmission line for microwaves.

children.name: RxTx
children.shortdesc: The RxTx is part of the Radio Section in the transceiver.

children.name: SSPA
children.shortdesc: The SSPA amplifies the radar signals.

children.name: Radar Digitizing Unit
children.shortdesc: The Radar Digitizing Unit (RDU) creates the radar tracks according to the received data.

children.name: AIS Base Station
children.shortdesc: The AIS Base Station receives and monitors AIS traffic within the VHF coverage of that unit and sends those information to the operator workstation.

children.name: Power Supply Unit (PSU)
children.shortdesc: The Power Supply Unit (PSU) supplies power to the RDF system.

children.name: Sensors
children.shortdesc: The Sensors for Site type 5 (Cam, Radar, AIS, RDF) are composed of the TERMA radar, the NightOwl-M daylight/IR camera, the AIS and the RDF.

children.name: TERMA Radar
children.shortdesc: The TERMA Radar uses electro magnetic waves to discover objects.

children.name: GPS Antenna
children.shortdesc: The GPS Antenna is a component of the synchronization system.

children.name: VHF Antenna
children.shortdesc: The VHF Antenna converts electric power into radio waves, and vice versa.

children.name: AIS Assembly
children.shortdesc: The AIS Assembly is used to electronically exchange ship data.

children.name: Antenna Switching Unit (ASU)
children.shortdesc: The Antenna Switching Unit (ASU) switches channels between antenna arrays.

children.name: RDF Antenna
children.shortdesc: The RDF Antenna is a direction finding antenna.

children.name: RDF Receiver
children.shortdesc: The ASU and the GPS antenna are connected to a Receiver.

children.name: Static Protection Unit
children.shortdesc: The Static Protection Unit protects the equipment from electrical currents.

children.name: LCD KVM
children.shortdesc: The LCD KVM (Keyboard-Video-Mouse) is a control unit to access multiple computers.

children.name: IP KVM Switch
children.shortdesc: The IP KVM Switch transmits data between operators and target devices.

children.name: Monitoring PC
children.shortdesc: The Monitoring PC is a device where configuration, monitoring and maintenance are performed on the sensors, servers and network switches.

children.name: LAN Network Switch Type 3
children.shortdesc: The LAN Network Switch Type 3 is a networking device that links network segments or network devices.

children.name: Overview
children.shortdesc: Troubleshooting is the key to a well functioning system. This chapter provides information about the troubleshooting process, troubleshooting tools and describes important troubleshooting tasks.

children.name: Troubleshooting process
children.shortdesc: Describes the troubleshooting process and lists procedures that can be used in the troubleshooting process.

children.name: Troubleshooting tools
children.shortdesc: Short description of tools that can be used for troubleshooting.

children.name: Troubleshooting tasks
children.shortdesc: Troubleshooting tasks are mainly functional checks to determine whether a component is operational or not, to support the fault finding process.

children.name: Fire detection and suppression system - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies to failure at the fire detection and suppression system.

children.name: Motion Detector - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies in case of Motion Detector failure. The Motion Detector picks invisible infrared emissions coming from people and other heat sources without emitting any type of radiation, so proper adjustement is required.

children.name: HVAC Control Panel - Functional Check
children.shortdesc: The functional check of the HVAC Control Panel checks, if the HVAC works correctly.

children.name: Temperature Sensor - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: The standard (local) temperature sensor has 12" leads and comes installed from the factory. A secondary sensor is located internally on the main controller board and serves as a reference and back-up sensor to the local sensor.

children.name: UPS Battery kit - Functional Check
children.shortdesc: Functional check of a UPS Battery Kit.

children.name: UPS System - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies to failure at the UPS System in the Ground Shelter. The UPS System has both LED and audible signals that can help in troubleshooting a malfunction.

children.name: MCCB (UPS MDB) - Exchange
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies to failure at the MCCB in the UPS MDB. Prior to checking the breaker, verify the errors on the UPS.

children.name: Circuit Breaker (20/10 Amp 3 pole, 10 Amp 1 pole) - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: Prior to verifying the breaker, consult the power diagram and read the label to identify what is the equipment it protects.

children.name: Main Contactor (UPS) - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: Prior to verifying the Main Contactor, consult the power diagram.

children.name: Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit - Functional Check
children.shortdesc: Functional check of the Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit.

children.name: Air Filter, Transceiver - Removal, Check and Installation
children.shortdesc: Exchange of the Air Filter, Transceiver.

children.name: KVM Switch - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies in case of KVM Switch failure.

children.name: LCD Rack Console - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies to failure at the LCD Rack Console. The steps in this procedure should be followed in order until the failure is identified or fixed. If the failure is not identified, the equipment can be exchanged.

children.name: LAN Switch - Troubleshooting
children.shortdesc: This troubleshooting procedure applies to failure at the LAN Switch. The steps in this procedure should be performed after the equipment has been checked remotly with the network management tool.

children.name: Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit - Functional Check
children.shortdesc: Functional check of the Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit.

children.name: Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit - Exchange
children.shortdesc: The exchange of the Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit consists of a procedure for removal and a procedure for installation.

children.name: Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit - Removal
children.shortdesc: Removal of the Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit.

children.name: Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit - Installation
children.shortdesc: Installation of the Fixed Outdoor Camera Unit.

children.shortdesc: The exchange of the Door Closer consists of a procedure for removal and a procedure for installation.

children.name: Door Closer - Removal
children.shortdesc: Removal of the Door Closer.

children.name: Door Closer - Installation
children.shortdesc: Installation of the Door Closer.

children.shortdesc: The functional check of the HVAC Control Panel checks, if the HVAC works correctly.

children.name: Controller - Exchange
children.shortdesc: The exchange of the CX9020 controller consists of a procedure for removal and a procedure for installation. These instructions are for the SCADA System represented in the Ground Shelter. Follow similar instructions for the SCADA System located in the Upmast Cabinet.

children.name: Controller - Removal
children.shortdesc: Removal of the Controller.

children.name: Controller - Installation
children.shortdesc: Installation of the CX9020 controller. The CX9020 controller must be installed onto the mounting rail located in the slots 20 and 21 in the Upmast Cabinet. The mounting rail is located at the very top right side of the Upmast Cabinet.
